p: A number of socio-economic variables can contribute to a better understanding of HCPS transmission. The human development index (HDI) is a summary measure of key dimensions of human development and can be a suitable metric of the socio-economic factors that influence HCPS risk [ 32]. Therefore, HDI was also included as a covariate in the model, and was extracted at municipality level from IBGE (accessible at www.ibge.gov.br), being available for 1991, 2000 and 2010. We used HDI data from 1991 to predict disease incidence from 1993 to 1998, data from 2000 to predict disease incidence from 1999 to 2005 and from 2010 to predict disease incidence from 2006 to 2012.
